Package org.cesecore.keys.util

Class KeyTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cesecore.keys.util.KeyTools
  • public final class KeyTools
extends Object
    Tools to handle common key and keystore operations.
    Version:
    $Id: KeyTools.java 29338 2018-06-26 05:55:57Z samuellb $

    • Method Detail

      • genKeys

        public static KeyPair genKeys​(String keySpec,
                              AlgorithmParameterSpec algSpec,
                              String keyAlg)
                       throws InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Generates a keypair
        Parameters:
        keySpec - string specification of keys to generate, typical value is 2048 for RSA keys, 1024 for DSA keys, secp256r1 for ECDSA keys, or null if algspec is to be used.
        algSpec - AlgorithmParameterSpec of keys to generate, typically an EXParameterSpec for EC keys, or null if keySpec is to be used.
        keyAlg - algorithm of keys to generate, typical value is RSA, DSA or ECDSA, see AlgorithmConstants.KEYALGORITHM_XX
        Returns:
        KeyPair the generated keypair
        Throws:
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if the given parameters are inappropriate for this key pair generator.
        See Also:
        AlgorithmConstants, X962NamedCurves, NISTNamedCurves, SECNamedCurves, AlgorithmConstants.KEYALGORITHM_RSA

      • genKeys

        public static KeyPair genKeys​(String keySpec,
                              String keyAlg)
                       throws InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Parameters:
        keySpec - Spec
        keyAlg - Algorithm
        Returns:
        Key pair
        Throws:
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if the given parameters are inappropriate for this key pair generator.
        See Also:
        genKeys(String,AlgorithmParameterSpec,String)

      • getECPublicKeyWithParams

        public static PublicKey getECPublicKeyWithParams​(PublicKey pk,
                                                 String keySpec)
                                          throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                 NoSuchProviderException,
                                                 InvalidKeySpecException
        An ECDSA key can be stripped of the curve parameters so it only contains the public point, and this is not enough to use the key for verification. However, if we know the curve name we can fill in the curve parameters and get a usable EC public key
        Parameters:
        pk - PublicKey, org.ejbca.cvc.PublicKeyEC, that might miss parameters, if parameters are there we do not touch the public key just return it unchanged
        keySpec - name of curve for example brainpoolp224r1
        Returns:
        PublicKey with parameters from the named curve
        Throws:
        NoSuchProviderException - if provider not found
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - if algorithm not found
        InvalidKeySpecException - if spec is invalid

      • getECPublicKeyWithParams

        public static PublicKey getECPublicKeyWithParams​(PublicKey pk,
                                                 PublicKey pkwithparams)
                                          throws InvalidKeySpecException
        An ECDSA key can be stripped of the curve parameters so it only contains the public point, and this is not enough to use the key for verification. However, if we know the curve name we can fill in the curve parameters and get a usable EC public key
        Parameters:
        pk - PublicKey, org.ejbca.cvc.PublicKeyEC, that might miss parameters, if parameters are there we do not touch the public key just return it unchanged
        pkwithparams - PublicKey, org.ejbca.cvc.PublicKeyEC, that contains all parameters.
        Returns:
        PublicKey with parameters from the named curve
        Throws:
        InvalidKeySpecException - if the key specification in pkwithparams was invalid

      • getKeyLength

        public static int getKeyLength​(PublicKey pk)
        Gets the key length of supported keys
        Parameters:
        pk - PublicKey used to derive the keysize
        Returns:
        -1 if key is unsupported, otherwise a number >= 0. 0 usually means the length can not be calculated, for example if the key is an EC key and the "implicitlyCA" encoding is used.

      • getKeyGenSpec

        public static AlgorithmParameterSpec getKeyGenSpec​(PublicKey pk)
        Gets the key AlgorithmParameterSpec of supported keys. Can be used to initialize a KeyPairGenerator to generate a key of equal type and size.
        Parameters:
        pk - PublicKey used to derive the AlgorithmParameterSpec
        Returns:
        null if key is unsupported or pk is null, otherwise a AlgorithmParameterSpec.

      • createP12

        public static KeyStore createP12​(String alias,
                                 PrivateKey privKey,
                                 Certificate cert,
                                 Certificate cacert)
                          throws CertificateException,
                                 NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                 InvalidKeySpecException
        Creates PKCS12-file that can be imported in IE or Firefox. The alias for the private key is set to 'privateKey' and the private key password is null.
        Parameters:
        alias - the alias used for the key entry
        privKey - RSA private key
        cert - user certificate
        cacert - CA-certificate or null if only one cert in chain, in that case use 'cert'.
        Returns:
        KeyStore containing PKCS12-keystore
        Throws:
        CertificateException - if the certificate couldn't be parsed
        CertificateEncodingException - if the encoded bytestream of the certificate couldn't be retrieved
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the algorithm defined in privKey couldn't be found
        InvalidKeySpecException - if the key specification defined in privKey couldn't be found

      • createP12

        public static KeyStore createP12​(String alias,
                                 PrivateKey privKey,
                                 Certificate cert,
                                 Collection<Certificate> cacerts)
                          throws CertificateException,
                                 NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                 InvalidKeySpecException
        Creates PKCS12-file that can be imported in IE or Firefox. The alias for the private key is set to 'privateKey' and the private key password is null.
        Parameters:
        alias - the alias used for the key entry
        privKey - RSA private key
        cert - user certificate
        cacerts - Collection of X509Certificate, or null if only one cert in chain, in that case use 'cert'.
        Returns:
        KeyStore containing PKCS12-keystore
        Throws:
        CertificateException - if the certificate couldn't be parsed
        CertificateEncodingException - if the encoded bytestream of the certificate couldn't be retrieved
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the algorithm defined in privKey couldn't be found
        InvalidKeySpecException - if the key specification defined in privKey couldn't be found

      • createP12

        public static KeyStore createP12​(String alias,
                                 PrivateKey privKey,
                                 Certificate cert,
                                 Certificate[] cachain)
                          throws CertificateEncodingException,
                                 CertificateException,
                                 NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                 InvalidKeySpecException
        Creates PKCS12-file that can be imported in IE or Firefox. The alias for the private key is set to 'privateKey' and the private key password is null.
        Parameters:
        alias - the alias used for the key entry
        privKey - RSA private key
        cert - user certificate
        cachain - CA-certificate chain or null if only one cert in chain, in that case use 'cert'.
        Returns:
        KeyStore containing PKCS12-keystore
        Throws:
        CertificateException - if the certificate couldn't be parsed
        CertificateEncodingException - if the encoded bytestream of the certificate couldn't be retrieved
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the algorithm defined in privKey couldn't be found
        InvalidKeySpecException - if the key specification defined in privKey couldn't be found

      • createJKS

        public static KeyStore createJKS​(String alias,
                                 PrivateKey privKey,
                                 String password,
                                 X509Certificate cert,
                                 Certificate[] cachain)
                          throws KeyStoreException
        Creates JKS-file that can be used with JDK. The alias for the private key is set to 'privateKey' and the private key password is null.
        Parameters:
        alias - the alias used for the key entry
        privKey - RSA private key
        password - user's password
        cert - user certificate
        cachain - CA-certificate chain or null if only one cert in chain, in that case use 'cert'.
        Returns:
        KeyStore containing JKS-keystore
        Throws:
        KeyStoreException - is storing the certificate failed, perhaps because the alias is already being used?

      • createKeyStore

        public static KeyStore createKeyStore​(byte[] keyStoreBytes,
                                      String password)
                               throws KeyStoreException,
                                      NoSuchProviderException,
                                      IOException,
                                      NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                      CertificateException
        Generates KeyStore from key store byte array. Token type (JKS / P12) is determined automatically by the byte array content
        Parameters:
        keyStoreBytes - byte array containing key store
        password - of the key store
        Returns:
        JKS or P12 KeyStore depending of input content
        Throws:
        KeyStoreException - If store fails
        NoSuchProviderException - If provider not found
        IOException - On I/O error
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - If algorithm not found
        CertificateException - on invalid certificate

      • getSinglePemFromKeyStore

        public static byte[] getSinglePemFromKeyStore​(KeyStore ks,
                                              char[] password)
                                       throws KeyStoreException,
                                              CertificateEncodingException,
                                              IOException,
                                              UnrecoverableKeyException,
                                              NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Convert a KeyStore to PEM format.
        Parameters:
        ks - Key store
        password - password
        Returns:
        PEM
        Throws:
        KeyStoreException - if store fails
        CertificateEncodingException - If cert cannot be parsed
        IOException - on i/o error
        UnrecoverableKeyException - if key cannot be read
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - if algorithm not found

      • getAsPem

        public static String getAsPem​(PublicKey publicKey)
                       throws IOException
        Parameters:
        publicKey - Key
        Returns:
        a buffer with the public key in PEM format
        Throws:
        IOException - on I/O error

      • getCertChain

        public static Certificate[] getCertChain​(KeyStore keyStore,
                                         String privateKeyAlias)
                                  throws KeyStoreException
        Retrieves the certificate chain from a keystore.
        Parameters:
        keyStore - the keystore, which has been loaded and opened.
        privateKeyAlias - the alias of the privatekey for which the certchain belongs.
        Returns:
        array of Certificate, or null if no certificates are found.
        Throws:
        KeyStoreException - on fail

        Returns:

      • isUsingExportableCryptography

        public static boolean isUsingExportableCryptography()
        Detect if "Unlimited Strength" Policy files has bean properly installed.
        Returns:
        true if key strength is limited

      • signData

        public static byte[] signData​(PrivateKey privateKey,
                              String signatureAlgorithm,
                              byte[] data)
                       throws SignatureException,
                              NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                              InvalidKeyException,
                              NoSuchProviderException
        Sign provided data with specified private key and algortihm
        Parameters:
        privateKey - the private key
        signatureAlgorithm - a valid signature algorithm such as AlgorithmConstants.SIGALG_SHA256_WITH_RSA
        data - the data to sign
        Returns:
        the signature
        Throws:
        SignatureException - If sig is invalid
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - If algorithm not found
        InvalidKeyException - if key is invalid
        NoSuchProviderException - if BouncyCastleProvider is not installed

      • verifyData

        public static boolean verifyData​(PublicKey publicKey,
                                 String signatureAlgorithm,
                                 byte[] data,
                                 byte[] signature)
                          throws SignatureException,
                                 NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                 InvalidKeyException,
                                 NoSuchProviderException
        Verify signed data with specified public key, algorith and signature
        Parameters:
        publicKey - the public key
        signatureAlgorithm - a valid signature algorithm
        data - the data to verify
        signature - the signature
        Returns:
        true if the signature is ok
        Throws:
        SignatureException - if signature is invalid
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - if algo not found
        InvalidKeyException - if key is invalid
        NoSuchProviderException - if BouncyCastleProvider is not installed

      • testKey

        public static void testKey​(PrivateKey priv,
                           PublicKey pub,
                           String sProvider)
                    throws InvalidKeyException
        Testing a key pair to verify that it is possible to first sign and then verify with it.
        Parameters:
        priv - private key to sign a string with
        pub - public key to verify the signature with
        sProvider - A provider used for signing with the private key, or null if "BC" should be used.
        Throws:
        InvalidKeyException - if the public key can not be used to verify a string signed by the private key, because the key is wrong or the signature operation fails for other reasons such as a NoSuchAlgorithmException or SignatureException. if the provider is not installed.

                                      PrintStream ps)
        Print parameters of public part of a key.
        Parameters:
        publK - the key
        ps - stream to print to.

      • getPublicKeyFromBytes

        public static PublicKey getPublicKeyFromBytes​(byte[] asn1EncodedPublicKey)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getBytesFromPEM

        public static byte[] getBytesFromPEM​(String pem,
                                     String beginMarker,
                                     String endMarker)
        Extracts the binary data from a PEM of a specified kind, e.g. public key.
        Parameters:
        pem - PEM data to extract from. May contain other types of data as well.
        beginMarker - E.g. CertTools.BEGIN_PUBLIC_KEY
        endMarker - E.g. CertTools.END_PUBLIC_KEY
        Returns:
        The first entry of the matching type, or null if it couldn't be parsed.

      • getBytesFromPublicKeyFile

        public static byte[] getBytesFromPublicKeyFile​(byte[] file)
                                        throws CertificateParsingException
        Extracts the binary DER data from a public key file. The file may be either in PEM format or in DER format. In the latter case, the file contents is returned as-is.
        Parameters:
        file - Data of a PEM or DER file.
        Returns:
        DER encoded public key.
        Throws:
        CertificateParsingException - If the data isn't a public key in either PEM or DER format.

        Returns:

        Returns:
